newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares up at noon on light retail demand.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares up at noon on light retail demand.

text.p: Shanghai B shares were marginally higher at midday on Thursday, buoyed by light bargain hunting by retail investors as institutions kept to the sidelines, brokers said.
Institutions were awaiting the release of interim corporate profits due over the next month, they said.
There was little market response to news that economic tsar Zhu Rongji urged lumbering state firms to look to stock markets as a means to raise capital rather than relying on credit.
The B share index edged up 0.192 point or 0.26 percent to 73.123 at midday.
Volume was 2.6 million shares worth $1.3 million.
"Bargain-hunting emerged after the losses over the past few days, but trading was not active amid unclear market direction," one broker said.
Brokers put technical support at the 73-point level.
Major newspapers prominently reported the remarks of Vice Premier Zhu during a recent tour of the hard hit state sector in the industrial province of Liaoning.
Zhu also called on state firms that had listed their shares not to believe that a public offer was a ticket to do as they pleased.
"Zhu's comments were a positive factor for the market," another broker said.
"But the market lacks capital to start a bull run amid overseas institutions turned their interest to the Hong Kong stock market," another broker said.
Of the 45 B share issues, 30 were traded, with 12 gaining ground. Nine fell and nine were unchanged.
Shanghai Yaohua Pilkington Glass was the morning's star performer on speculative demand, surging $0.026 or 8.02 percent to $0.350 on thin volume of 23,000 shares.
Shanghai's A share index extended its advance as Zhu's comments appeared to suggest a cautious note of official encouragement for the market.
The index gained 7.575 points or 0.61 percent to 1,243.031 points on volume of 148.9 million shares worth 1.6 billion yuan.
The SSE30 blue chip index put on 52.059 points or 1.40 percent to 3,763.258 points.
Huanghe Machinery and Electronics was the big gainer on talk of improved results, rising 0.31 yuan or 6.60 percent to 5.00 yuan on volume of 2.7 million shares.
